data.text: @robscotingram @bensimmoneau NYT data this morning. MA is 10th worst in daily avg deaths at .69 per 100k (national is .58) despite being 2nd best in hospitalizations at 7 per 100k (national is 15) & with avg daily cases at 15 per 100k (national is 18). The daily avg is based on last 7 days of data reported.
@cotter_dave @bensimmoneau By date of death falling steadily. (Ignore the last few days of incomplete data) https://t.co/ezfOii0dO2
@cotter_dave @bensimmoneau Tuesdays always include the weekend count so always a highest day of week

@bensimmoneau @WCVB my guess is, after a school break and most schools testing on monday along with teachers testing, if that’s the case these numbers aren’t bad. exciting part is hospitalization is falling fast
@bensimmoneau the covidian leftists must be triggered that masks are going away in boston on march 5th.
@bensimmoneau Guessing drop in mask requirements across the board and new variant will result in more cases. Hope to be wrong. Waste water report looking good so far https://t.co/FxDcTt0dTR
@bensimmoneau Perhaps due to school vacation travel?
@bensimmoneau Why aren’t deaths dropping. It’s been more that a two week drop in hospitalizations. The death to hospitalization ratio is out of whack.
